page.title: 08FORESTRY IN MIDDLE RASEN
page.content: To the north and east of Market Rasen in the parish of{Middle Rasen}there is a large area of wooded land. The trees were planted by man and have not been there for very long. The original trees were planted just before the Second World War in 1937. This is in the area near Walesby Grange which now covers nearly 230 hectares. More trees were planted between 1947 and 1950. Later plantations were set out at Usselby and nearer to Middle Rasen between 1957 and 1965. These areas total nearly 90 hectares. The trees which were planted are mostly Corsican Pine and Scots Pine but there are some Norway Spruce. Around some of the plantations there are Silver Birch trees. At present trees are being harvested in the Osgodby Moor Plantation and being used for general purposes.
